definition: to cup one's hands in salute/to surround/to arch/to dig earth with the snout/arched

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: A big archway leads through into a courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 一條大拱道直通向一座庭院。

definition: lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
to greet by raising clasped hands
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father)/old friend
to bow with hands held in front
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
